intro: Androsace villosa subsp. chamaejasme, commonly known as the hairy androsace, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a yellowish throat. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its foliage consists of opposite, oval to lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs.
